title: Recovering the microSD Card
answer:
**![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150601211845818001.png)**

**Recovering the microSD Card**

Has your phone ever displayed a message saying "The microSD card is damaged, please reformat it"? This document helps you recover the microSD card without reformatting it. 

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150601211846807002.png)

1. Connect your phone to a computer. On the computer, find the movable disk corresponding to the microSD card in **My Computer**. 

2. Click **Start** > **Run**. 

3. Run **chkdsk /f ***Drive Letter*. The variable is the drive letter of the microSD card. 

4. Press **Enter**. 

5. Right-click the microSD card's drive letter, click **Properties** > **Tools** > **Check now**, and select **Automatically fix file system errors** and **Scan for and attempt recovery of bad sectors**. 

(Make sure you select these two options. Otherwise the recovery may fail.)

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20150601211852431003.png)
